title: Acid-Base Titration
description: Determine the concentration of an unknown acid solution using a standard base solution. Master the art of precise measurements and endpoint detection.

stepDetails.title: Prepare Equipment
stepDetails.description: Set up the burette in the stand and rinse with distilled water, then with the NaOH solution. Fill the burette with 0.1M NaOH solution.

stepDetails.title: Prepare Sample
stepDetails.description: Transfer exactly 25.0mL of the unknown HCl solution into a clean conical flask.

stepDetails.title: Add Indicator
stepDetails.description: Add 2-3 drops of phenolphthalein indicator to the acid solution in the conical flask. Place on white tile for better endpoint visibility.

stepDetails.title: Initial Titration
stepDetails.description: Record the initial burette reading. Begin titrating by adding NaOH solution slowly while swirling the flask continuously.

stepDetails.title: Identify Endpoint
stepDetails.description: Continue adding NaOH drop by drop near the endpoint. The endpoint is reached when the solution turns permanently pale pink.

stepDetails.title: Calculate Concentration
stepDetails.description: Record the final burette reading and calculate the volume of NaOH used. Use the formula to determine the concentration of the HCl solution.

safetyInfo: Handle all chemicals with care. NaOH is caustic and can cause burns. HCl is corrosive. Always wear safety goggles and handle glassware carefully. Work in a well-ventilated area.
